paragraphs.text:
%angular

Getting started using Spark Scala APIs

  • Know more about creating SnappySession
  • Use of "exec scala" keywords in the "%jdbc" interpreter allows submitting scala code along with SQL queries. More information available here. Ex.
     %jdbc
     exec scala
     //Scala Code
     println("Hello World") ;
     -- SQL Statement
     show tables in app ;
  • Monitor the Cluster, check memory consumption using Monitoring Console
    The Dashboard tab can be used to monitor the cluster and check the memory consumed by the samples.
Anonymous user needs to clone this notebook to execute the paragraphs. Clone option available in the pane next to name of the notebook at the top of the page.

msg.data:
Getting started using Spark Scala APIs

  • Know more about creating SnappySession
  • Use of "exec scala" keywords in the "%jdbc" interpreter allows submitting scala code along with SQL queries. More information available here. Ex.
     %jdbc
     exec scala
     //Scala Code
     println("Hello World") ;
     -- SQL Statement
     show tables in app ;
  • Monitor the Cluster, check memory consumption using Monitoring Console
    The Dashboard tab can be used to monitor the cluster and check the memory consumed by the samples.
Anonymous user needs to clone this notebook to execute the paragraphs. Clone option available in the pane next to name of the notebook at the top of the page.

paragraphs.title: Step 1. Create a SnappySession: A SnappySession extends SparkSession so you can mutate data, get much higher performance, etc.
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

// common session used across notebooks
val snappyNoteSession = new org.apache.spark.sql.SnappySession(sc)
// copy over the credentials from the connection
snappyNoteSession.conf.set("user", snappysession.conf.get("user", "app"))
snappyNoteSession.conf.set("password", snappysession.conf.get("password", "app"))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 2. Create a small Dataset using Spark's APIs
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

import snappysession.implicits._
val ds = Seq((1,"a"), (2, "b"), (3, "c")).toDS()

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 3. Define a schema for the table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

import org.apache.spark.sql.types._
val tableSchema = StructType(Array(StructField("CustKey", IntegerType, false),StructField("CustName", StringType, false)))

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 4. Create a column table with a simple schema [String, Int] and default options
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

//Column tables manage data in columnar form and offer superior performance for analytic class queries
snappyNoteSession.createTable(tableName = "colTable",
        provider = "column", // Create a SnappyData Column table
        schema = tableSchema,
        options = Map.empty[String, String], // Map for options.
        allowExisting = false)

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 5. Insert the created Dataset to the column table "colTable"
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

 ds.write.insertInto("colTable")
// Check the total row count.
snappyNoteSession.table("colTable").count

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 6. Create a Row object using Spark's API and insert the row into the table

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 7. Create a "row" table with a simple schema [String, Int] and default options
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

//Row formatted tables are better when datasets constantly change or access is selective (like based on a key)
snappyNoteSession.createTable(tableName = "rowTable",
          provider = "row",
          schema = tableSchema,
          options = Map.empty[String, String],
          allowExisting = false)

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 8. Insert the created Dataset to the row table "rowTable"
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

ds.write.insertInto("rowTable")
//Check the row count
snappyNoteSession.table("rowTable").count

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 9. Insert a new record and check the row count
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

snappyNoteSession.insert("rowTable", Row(4, "d"))
//Check the row count now
snappyNoteSession.table("rowTable").count

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 10. Change some data in a row table
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

//Updating a row for customer with custKey = 1
snappyNoteSession.update(tableName = "rowTable", filterExpr = "CUSTKEY=1",
                newColumnValues = Row("d"), updateColumns = "CUSTNAME")

snappyNoteSession.table("rowTable").orderBy("CUSTKEY").show

//Delete the row for customer with custKey = 1
snappyNoteSession.delete(tableName = "rowTable", filterExpr = "CUSTKEY=1")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]

paragraphs.title: Step 11. Drop existing tables
paragraphs.text:
%jdbc
exec scala

//Drop the existing tables
snappyNoteSession.dropTable("rowTable", ifExists = true)
snappyNoteSession.dropTable("colTable", ifExists = true)
println("Tables dropped successfully!!")

table.tableOptionSpecHash: [{"name":"useFilter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable filter for columns"},{"name":"showPagination","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable pagination for better navigation"},{"name":"showAggregationFooter","valueType":"boolean","defaultValue":false,"widget":"checkbox","description":"Enable a footer for displaying aggregated values"}]
